properties.title: Azure Container Apps LZA - Secure Baseline Deployment

body.query: ResourceContainers | where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions' | where properties.state =~ 'enabled' | project label=tostring(name), description=subscriptionId, value=subscriptionId | order by label asc

elements.name: workloadName
elements.label: Workload Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the workload that is being deployed. Up to 10 characters long.

validations.message: The value must have a length of at least 2.
The value must have a length of at most 10.

elements.name: environment
elements.label: Environment
elements.toolTip: The name of the environment (e.g. "dev", "test", "prod", "uat", "dr", "qa"). Up to 8 characters long.

validations.message: The value must have a length of at most 8.

elements.name: deployZoneRedundantResources
elements.label: Deploy Zone Redundant Resources
elements.toolTip: If true, any resources that support AZ will be deployed in all three AZ. However if the selected region is not supporting AZ, this parameter needs to be set to false

elements.name: deployAzurePolicies
elements.label: Deploy Azure Policies for Azure Container Apps
elements.toolTip: If true, built-in and custom Azure Policies for Azure Container Apps will be deployed in the spoke Resource Group. If false, no Azure Policies will be deployed.

elements.name: location
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Azure region where the resources will be deployed in

options.text: All the resources will be deployed following the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure naming conventions. Two resource groups will be created: one for the hub resources and one for the spoke resources. The names of the resource groups will be generated based on the workload name and environment. You can override the names of the resource groups by specifying the names below. The names must follow the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure naming conventions.

link.label: Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure: Naming conventions

elements.name: hubResourceGroupName
elements.label: Hub Resource Group Name
elements.toolTip: Optional. The name of the hub resource group to create the resources in. If set, it overrides the name generated by the template.

elements.name: spokeResourceGroupName
elements.label: Spoke Resource Group Name
elements.toolTip: Optional. The name of the resource group to create the resources in. If set, it overrides the name generated by the template.

elements.name: sectionHubNew
elements.label: CIDR Settings for new Hub network and subnets

options.text: You can accept the default address spaces, as shown below, or you can use your own.

link.label: What address ranges can I use in my Virtual Networks?

elements.name: deployHub
elements.label: Deploy Hub
elements.toolTip: Enable or disable the creation of a hub network and its supporting resources.

elements.name: vnetAddressPrefixes
elements.label: Hub Virtual Network Address Space
elements.toolTip: The address prefixs to use for the Hub virtual network.

elements.name: gatewaySubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Gateway Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR to use for the Gateway Subnet.

elements.name: azureFirewallSubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Azure Firewall Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR to use for the Azure Firewall subnet.

elements.name: azureFirewallSubnetManagementAddressPrefix
elements.label: Azure Firewall Management Subnet Address Prefix (azFW Basic)
elements.toolTip: CIDR to use for the Azure Firewall Management subnet - required by Azure Firewall Basic.

elements.name: bastionSubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Bastion Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR to use for the Azure Bastion subnet.

elements.name: sectionSpoke
elements.label: CIDR Settings for the Spoke network and subnets

options.text: You can accept the default address spaces, as shown below, or you can use your own.

link.label: What address ranges can I use in my Virtual Networks?

elements.name: spokeVNetAddressPrefixes
elements.label: Spoke Virtual Network Address Space
elements.toolTip: CIDR of the Spoke Virtual Network.

elements.name: spokeInfraSubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Spoke Infra Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR of the Spoke Infrastructure Subnet.

elements.name: spokePrivateEndpointsSubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Spoke Private Endpoints Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR of the Spoke Private Endpoints Subnet.

elements.name: vmJumpBoxSubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: VM Jump Box Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR to use for the virtual machine subnet.

elements.name: spokeApplicationGatewaySubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Spoke Application Gateway Subnet Address Prefix
elements.toolTip: CIDR of the Spoke Application Gateway Subnet.

elements.name: routeSpokeTrafficInternally
elements.label: Route Spoke Traffic Internally
elements.toolTip: Enable this if you would like to keep traffic that is internal to the spoke (e.g. container app to database) from being routed to the hub. This can significantly alleviate load on components such as hub firewalls and decrease excess traffic.

elements.name: vmJumpboxOSType
elements.label: Vm Jumpbox OS Type
elements.toolTip: Select if you want to deploy a hump-box VM, and if so, which OS type.

options.text: You can accept the default VM size, as shown below, or you can use your own.

elements.name: vmSize
elements.label: VM Size
elements.toolTip: The size of the virtual machine to create. See https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/sizes for more information.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 8-15 characters long.

constraints.customValidationMessage: The password must contain at least 12 characters, with at least 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase and 1 number.

elements.name: vmLinuxSshAuthorizedKeys
elements.toolTip: The SSH public key to use for the virtual machine. https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/linux/mac-create-ssh-keys

elements.name: workloadProfile
elements.label: Deploy Hub
elements.toolTip: Enable this if you would like to deploy a dedicated workload profile called default.

elements.name: enableBastion
elements.label: Deploy Bastion
elements.toolTip: Enable or disable the creation of the Azure Bastion.

elements.name: deployRedisCache
elements.label: Deploy Redis Cache
elements.toolTip: Optional, default value is false. If true, Azure Cache for Redis (Premium SKU), together with Private Endpoint and the relavant Private DNS Zone will be deployed

elements.name: deployHelloWorldSample
elements.label: Deploy Hello World Sample
elements.toolTip: Enable or disable the deployment of the Hello World Sample App. If disabled, the Application Gateway will not be deployed.

elements.name: enableApplicationInsights
elements.label: Enable Application Insights
elements.toolTip: Enable or disable the createion of Application Insights.

elements.name: enableDaprInstrumentation
elements.label: Enable Dapr Instrumentation
elements.toolTip: Enable or disable Dapr Application Instrumentation Key used for Dapr telemetry. If Application Insights is not enabled, this parameter is ignored.

elements.name: ddosProtectionMode
elements.label: Enable DDoS Protection
elements.toolTip: DDoS protection mode for the Public IP of the Application Gateway. Allowed values are 'VirtualNetworkInherited', 'Enabled' and 'Disabled'

elements.name: enableTelemetry
elements.label: Enable Telemetry
elements.toolTip: Enable usage and telemetry feedback to Microsoft.

elements.name: applicationGatewayFqdn
elements.label: Application Gateway Fqdn
elements.toolTip: The FQDN of the Application Gateway. Must match the TLS Certificate.

elements.name: enableApplicationGatewayCertificate
elements.label: Enable Application Gateway Certificate
elements.toolTip: Enable or disable Application Gateway Certificate (PFX).

elements.name: applicationGatewayCertificateKeyName
elements.label: Application Gateway Certificate Key Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the certificate key to use for Application Gateway certificate.

options.text: Please be informed that currently Azure OpenAI is in preview and only available in limited regions. Also your azure subscription needs to be allow-listed.

elements.name: deployOpenAi
elements.label: Deploy OpenAI
elements.toolTip: set to true if you want to deploy OpenAI
